page.title: 11"No!" to boundary proposal
page.content:
In the autumn of 1984 the North Warwickshire Borough Council suggested to the Boundary Commission that the villages of Witherley and Ratcliffe Culey and seven other villages be transferred from Leicestershire to Warwickshire by changing the county boundary.
At present this boundary runs along the old Roman road called the Watling Street, and has done for over a thousand years. Although these villages are on the edge of Leicestershire, and although many of the villagers work and shop in Warwickshire towns nearby, it was evident that they strongly rejected this proposal. Parish meetings were crowded out, and virtually unanimous opposition was expressed.
